name: NetworkInterface
shortDesc: Describes a network interface in an Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) instance for AWS CloudFormation. This is provided in a list in the NetworkInterfaces property of AWS::EC2::Instance.

properties.name: Description
properties.desc: The description of this network interface.

properties.name: GroupSet
properties.desc: A list of security group IDs associated with this network interface.

properties.name: PrivateIpAddress
properties.desc: Assigns a single private IP address to the network interface, which is used as the primary private IP address. If you want to specify multiple private IP address, use the PrivateIpAddresses property.

properties.name: PrivateIpAddresses
properties.desc: Assigns a list of private IP addresses to the network interface. You can specify a primary private IP address by setting the value of the Primary property to true in the PrivateIpAddressSpecification property. If you want Amazon EC2 to automatically assign private IP addresses, use the SecondaryPrivateIpAddressCount property and do not specify this property.
properties.update: Replacement if you change the primary private IP address. If not, update requires No interruption.

properties.name: SecondaryPrivateIpAddressCount
properties.desc: The number of secondary private IP addresses that Amazon EC2 automatically assigns to the network interface. Amazon EC2 uses the value of the PrivateIpAddress property as the primary private IP address. If you don't specify that property, Amazon EC2 automatically assigns both the primary and secondary private IP addresses.

properties.name: SourceDestCheck
properties.desc: Flag indicating whether traffic to or from the instance is validated.

properties.name: SubnetId
properties.desc: The ID of the subnet to associate with the network interface.

properties.name: Tags
properties.desc: An arbitrary set of tags (keyâ€“value pairs) for this network interface.

attributes.name: PrimaryPrivateIpAddress
attributes.desc: Returns the primary private IP address of the network interface. For example, 10.0.0.192.

attributes.name: SecondaryPrivateIpAddresses
attributes.desc: Returns the secondary private IP addresses of the network interface. For example, ["10.0.0.161", "10.0.0.162", "10.0.0.163"].
